item.title: USJ | Researchers discover a new species of bacteria in Portugal
item.description:
A team of local university researchers identified a new species of bacteria in the Salinas of Rio Maior, Portugal. The type of discovered organism, which lives in extreme environments, widens the limits of biological knowledge and may have implications in areas such as biomedicine, pharmacy or even spatial exploration
There is news in the field of microbiology thanks to the latest discovery of a team of researchers linked to the University of São José (USJ), led by André Antunes, interim director of the Institute of Sciences and Environment of the same educational institution. It is the discovery of a new species of bacteria from 12 samples collected in the Salinas of Rio Maior, in Portugal, which led to the establishment of the new species “Fodinibius alkaliphilus”. The species of bacteria previously known as “Alifodinibius salipaludis” for “Fodinibius salipaludis” was also reclassified. The conclusions appear in the article “Fodinibius alkaliphilus sp. Nov., Moderately halophilic and alkaliphilic bacterium isolated from an Inland Saltern in central and reclassification of aliifodinibius salipaludi as fodinibius salipalis sp. SYSTEMATIC AND EVOLUTIONARY MICROBIOLOGY. The scientific journal is a publication “reference for new macrobial data”, being the official publication of the International Procaryotes Systematic Committee and the Applied Bacteriology and Microbiology Division of the International Union of Microbiological Societies, describes a USJ note. In addition to André Antunes, the authors team includes researchers from the University of Science and Technology of Macau, coordinated by Marta Filipa Simões; Researchers at the University of Minho and Seville University. According to the same USJ note, "the new [bacteria] species grows better in salinities about four times higher than those of seawater and also prefers alkaline conditions, combining the ability to grow in different extreme environmental conditions." The importance of this type of studies, including analyzes to “such extreme environments”, is “future applications in a wide range of fields, including biomedical and pharmaceutical, but also extends to the discovery of new useful materials and the provision of useful information for future space exploration”. The same team of investigators is not stopped, as "other samples of these places are currently being investigated and new publications describing other new species are expected in the coming months." “This publication highlights the strengths of Macao in articulation with partners from Portuguese and Spanish -speaking countries, as well as its growing importance in the fields of biodiversity and biotechnology,” is still described. The Power of Salinas The researchers explain that "the species Aliifodinibius Salipaludis has been described, but their name has not yet been validly published." In field work the team isolated these species from “hypersaline environments, including saline, salt mines and saline soils”. Prior to the field work itself, the team conducted “an investigation to the microbial diversity of hypersaline environments in downtown Portugal”, with samples in the Rio Maior zone in July 2019, 12 genera bacteria were isolated from the Rio Maior salines. Located in the central area of ​​Portugal, in these Salinas there is “brine, which is about seven times more salty than seawater”, being “pumping from a well and generated by the crossing of a local groundwater course with an extensive salt deposit”. The article also gives a historical context of this location. "Although they were first referred to in twelfth-century documents, these places are believed to have been linked to salt extraction from prehistoric times. They offer a single scenario, as they are the only interior saline in Portugal and the only ones in full functioning throughout Europe." Thus, the study in question "was part of a bioprospecting campaign centered on this place", resulting in "in the isolation of a bacterial strain (N2T) and the discovery of a new putative species within the genus Fodinibius." In this work is determined “the taxonomic position of this new isolated based on the phenotypic, chemotaxonos and molecular properties”, is described. Importance for Science At HM, André Antunes explained that this discovery is, first of all, interesting to the scientific community, by bringing “additional information” and constituting a discovery “about the biodiversity that exists on our planet, more concretely at the macrobial level”. "So far, we have been able [general scientific community] to study less than 1 percent of all microbes species on the planet. In over 99 percent we have no idea what they are, what they do and what their abilities, or what impact on the environment and our lives," he explained. The researcher also said that "the microbes that come from extreme environments, and above all from environments with a lot of salt, which is the case of this species we now discover, are very interesting for a large range of biotechnology applications." "We can include things like the medical area, biomedicine, the production of new pharmaceutical compounds or the production of new biomaterials, such as bioplastics," said André Antunes. The academic even talks about applications in “more exotic areas, which are now beginning to have a little more visibility, such as the potential application in construction, the production of more sustainable cements or concrete structures that have the self -repair capacity”. This discovery also has some impact "for space exploration, more specifically to better understand what the limits of life are and where to seek life outside our planet." It is also included "very important implications for missions that are exploring Mars, namely as to the type of environments where it may be feasible to find past signs of life or present or other parts of the solar system." A job that continues The investigation is not for the Salinas of Rio Maior, and the team led by André Antunes last year, an expedition to Antarctica. “There are antarctic samples that we are currently studying and we have samples taken from the red sea bottom, where salt concentration is also quite high.” Therefore, the saga of discovering new bacteria and potential reclassifications in those that already exist. André Antunes says that the discovery of a new species of microbes "is quite important to science, not only for the perspective of science at the basic level, but because we can have a better perspective of diversity we have on the planet." “As we study extreme environments we can have additional information about what the limits of life are and how life adapts to extreme conditions.” Thus, André Antunes advocates investment in science so that there is later “an associated practical component, so it is not always easy to convince the financing entities”, as to this point. The researcher also points out that the article and the investigation fits “very well in the priorities of Macau and the USJ itself, with regard to the focus in the area of ​​environment, biodiversity and biotechnology, anchored in connection with Lusophony”.

item.title: Finance | Portugal withdraws Hong Kong from the list of tax havens
item.description:
From January 1, 2026, Hong Kong will no longer be part of the Portuguese tax paradise list, such as Liechtenstein and Uruguay. The authorities in the neighboring region have long called for the withdrawal, including official visits to Portugal. The Portugal-Hong Chamber of Commerce and Industry Kong emphasizes the decision consistent with the position of the European Union
The Hong Kong government has finally seen the desire, expressed several times, to leave the list of tax havens in Portugal. The change will be a reality from January 1, 2026, taking into account the ordinance published on Friday by the Ministry of Finance in the Diário da República. According to this document, Hong Kong is no longer included in the list of “clearly more favorable tax regimes”, the official name of the list commonly known as the “Fiscal Paradise List”. It reads at the Ordinance, signed by the Secretary of State for Tax Affairs, Claudia Reis Duarte, that “the governments of the Special Administrative Region of Hong Kong, the Principality of Liechtenstein and the East Republic of Uruguay drove formal requests” to the “revision of their framing in the list, which were the subject of positive opinions elaborated by the Tax and Customs Authority”. The withdrawal of these three countries and territories is officially on January 1 of next year. Thus, the Portuguese Government considers that the conditions are verified to, in the legally established terms, exclude those jurisdictions from the list of countries, territories or regions with clearly more favorable tax regimes ”. It is also noteworthy that “the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region, the Principality of Liechtenstein and the Eastern Republic of Uruguay are not on the European Union of Non-Cooperative Jurisdiction List, adopted by the European Union Council, which took place on February 18, 2025”. It is recalled that one of the last times that Hong Kong made a formal request to leave the list of tax havens was during the visit to Lisbon of the Secretary for Financial and Treasury Services, Christopher Hui Ching-Yu, last year, as a meeting with Secretary of State Claudia Reis Durte. There, and according to Lusa, the ruler of the neighboring region "expressed concern" for Hong Kong being considered a fiscal paradise since the list was created by the Portuguese authorities in 2004. The inclusion in the list “would subject Hong Kong companies to a tax increase and special measures” in Portugal, described the ruler, who recalled that the two parties signed an agreement to prevent double taxation, which came into force in 2012. In the same meeting, Christopher Hui reminded the Portuguese Secretary of State that the European Union (EU) removed, in February 2024, Raehk from the non -cooperative jurisdictions list for tax purposes, a decision that, in the secretary's understanding, “demonstrated the EU recognition of Hong Kong's efforts” to introduce measures that combat “the [fiscal] fiscal] resulting from the non -non -pair evasion taxation ”. Christopher Hui added that Hong Kong already fulfilled all European standards in this matter. It should be noted that, at the time, the Portuguese Minister of the Economy was Pedro Reis, who at an event about Christopher Hui's visit to Lisbon, said it was important to “maintain sustainable economic growth and take advantage of the opportunities for mutual investment” between Portugal and Hong Kong. Chamber of Commerce Rejubila However, the Portugal-Hong Chamber of Commerce and Industry Kong (PHKCCI, in the English acronym) issued a note in LinkedIn to highlight Hong Kong's exit from this list. "This milestone represents the culmination of a long-term and transverse process in Portugal, which involved continuous dialogue and coordination between successive governments, parliamentary parties and international partners. Although the consensus on the objective was solid, the process has gradually unfolded over more than a decade," he reads. For PHKCCI, the Portuguese State decision “restores coherence with the European Union's rules and reflects Portugal's commitment to a fair and current approach to its tax governance”, also stressing the “importance of respecting objective criteria, maintaining a permanent dialogue and ensuring legal and diplomatic rigor in the management of fiscal policy”. “As a chamber of commerce and industry Portugal-Hong Kong, we greeted this outcome as a step forward in the alignment of our bilateral environment of commerce and investment with predictability, transparency and good governance. We maintain a committed to facilitating constructive involvement between our markets, supporting the clarity in tax staff and fostering mutual confidence”, is referred to in the same note. According to the online newspaper Eco, the inclusion of a country or territory on the list of tax havens happens if there is no tax similar to IRC [tax on the income of legal persons], charged in Portugal, or the existence of tax benefits that are more favorable than in the European country. It also serves as a criterion for inclusion in the list administrative practices of countries or regions do not allow the effective exchange of tax information. All issues that Hong Kong considers to have exceeded and ensure that there is full respect for the fight against fiscal dropout. More concretely, and when his visit to Portugal last year, Secretary Christopher Hui spoke of the “Hong Kong efforts in the introduction of a foreign source performance regime (FSIE) for certain passive income to better combat transionic dropout resulting from the non -taxation”. In his view, "such efforts fully aligned the Hong Kong FSIE regime with FSIE regimes updated by the EU regimes in December 2022". MEXIDES IN FSIE According to an explanatory note from consultant PriceWaterhousecoopers (PWC), Hong Kong was added to the EU Observation list in October 2021. On that date, the EU was concerned that, under the then Foreign Source Exemption Scheme (FSIE), there could be situations in which companies without substantial economic activity in Hong Kong would not be subject to Tax regarding certain passive income from a foreign source (such as interest and royalties), thus resulting in situations of 'double non-tax', ”can be read. The following year, Raehk "promulgated legislative changes", namely in December 2022, to "improve and reinforce the FSIE regime against transfronical fiscal evasion." With the changes in force since 1 January 2023, “the four types of foreign source income”, such as dividends, interest, intellectual property income and alienation gains from the sale of corporate interests, are “being considered origin in Hong Kong and subject to profit tax if received in Hong Kong by an entity of a multinational group that exercises trade, profession or business in the business Territory, ”explains PWC,“ except if this entity meets the requirements of the applicable exception ”. After the EU's suggestion, "the Raehk government further perfected the FSIE regime to widen the scope of the covered incomes, including alienation gains from other types of assets (beyond corporate appearances) in order to align with the latest EU orientation, with effect from 1 January 2024". It was then that on February 20 last year the EU council published the conclusions of the semiannual EU review regarding the “non -cooperative jurisdictions for tax purposes”, the so -called “black list” of tax havens, as well as the “observation list” regarding the “state of cooperation with the EU in relation to the commitments made by cooperative jurisdictions to implement principles of good tax governance”. At that time Hong Kong was taken from the list, considering the EU that the territory had "fulfilled the commitment by changing the FSIE regime", highlighting PWC, in the same note, that Raehk is now "among the jurisdictions that cooperate with the EU and do not have pending commitments." According to PWC, "the Raehk government greeted the recognition of the EU of efforts to align its FSIE regime with the relevant requirements, as reflected in its removal from the EU observation list", and will also have "will continue to comply with international tax standards, while maintaining Hong Kong fiscal competitiveness."

item.title: Elections | Political programs focused on the economy and social support
item.description:
There are six lists of candidates for deputies by Via Direct, and another six by the way indirect. There are new guys, many out of departure and even deputies who decided to wander among suffrage. The main focuses of political programs continue to be employment, the promotion of the economy and the increase in social support
On September 14 will be chosen the deputies of the Legislative Assembly (AL), either by the vote of the people, in the direct via or by indirect way through the associations that represent the various professional sectors. The campaign is on the streets and the 12 lists have made available electoral programs whose content does not differ much from the interpeairs presented to the government in recent years, given that most of the list heads have been in AL for some time. Thus, issues such as the crisis in youth employment, the incentive for local consumption, the need for more social support and the regional integration of Macao in Hengqin and the Great Bay dominate the measures presented. In the case of list 1, the “Association of United Citizens of Macao” has roots in Fujian and is led by Mrs Song Pek Kei, who started very young to accompany businessman Chan Meng Kam in parliamentary Lides. Now he is accompanied by the young deputy Nick Lei, followed in third place, and on a list of ten people, Chan Lai Kei. In the work area, the list defends the creation of a share for residents in all professional areas, “support for employment and local companies”, and the guarantee that “85 percent, or more, of employees are local residents”. It is also advocated the release of “vacancies in the financial and management areas for qualified residents”, as well as the granting of a subsidy of five thousand patacas for “each resident eligible in employment support, unemployed or temporary workers”. The Nova Esperança list, led by José Pereira Coutinho, wants “employment for all” and promises to fight for “Macao's permanent residents priority at game dealers” and the establishment of a “compulsory system (pension fund), which protects 100 percent to the population”. item.title: SCO | China reveals ten -year plan for multipolar world
item.description:
In Tianjin was presented the initiative of global governance, a Beijing plan that defends multilateralism in the world geopolitical order. From the Shanghai Cooperation Organization came a new Defense Defense of the Multipolar World, as well as new “100 Small and Exemplary Projects” of financial support to the body's member countries
The Shanghai Cooperation Organization (SCO) approved a development strategy for the next decade, with the aim of promoting a multipolar world, Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi announced yesterday. The global governance initiative (GGI, on the English acronym) comes at a time when the regional bloc recognized, in a joint statement, that the worsening of geopolitical tensions represents a growing threat to the safety of its members. Speaking after the 25th SCO summit, which took place in Tianjin, in northeastern China, Wang said the development strategy until 2035 “defines the tone and a clear direction for the next decade”, considering it one of the main results of the meeting. The summit had as its backdrop the increase in friction between some of the main members of SCO and the United States of America (USA), namely due to sanctions and commercial fares applied by Donald Trump administration. Wang classified the meeting as the “most fruitful” to date, stressing that participants have issued a unified message against unilateral actions, in an implicit reference to Washington. "The summit firmly defended a multilateral trade mechanism centered on the World Trade Organization, rejected unilateral measures that violate the organization's rules and sent a clear message in support of equity against intimidation," said Chinese diplomacy chief. Wang also announced the creation of four new SCO security centers, focusing on combating regional security, transnational organized crime, drug trafficking and information security. According to Xinhua agency, Wang Yi also said that GGI has arrived "at the right time," given that "the world faces numerous challenges, including frequent regional turbulences, a slow economic growth and the increase in anti-globalization [ideas and movements." The GGI has as its principles “respect for sovereign equality, the observation of international law, the practice of multilateralism, the defense of a people centered on concrete actions”, concepts that are “in line with the purposes and principles of the United Nations Letter,” noted Wang Yi. The Chinese Foreign Minister also recalled that GGI is the “fourth global initiative proposed by President XI Jinping in recent years” after the launch of the global development initiative, the global security initiative and the global civilization initiative. According to the minister, "these four initiatives bring stability and predictability to a turbulent world, reflecting the active role and sense of responsibility of China in international affairs." A new statement From the summit also came the statement of Tianjin of the Council of Heads of State of SCO, where multilateralism is a watchword. “World politics and economics, as well as other areas of international relations, have undergone profound historical transformations. The international system is heading for a fairer, more egalitarian and representative multipolarity, opening new perspectives for national development and cooperation with mutual benefits,” he can read. In the same document, SCO Member States commit to “deepening long-term partnerships and further strengthening Shanghai's cooperation organization, in order to jointly preserve regional peace, safety and stability, promoting sustainable development” countries. In the statement, it is also established that SCO member countries "consider interference in internal affairs in other states under any pretexts, as well as the use of unilateral coercion measures that are not based on international law and harm the interests of other states." "Member States reaffirm their position of principle against the imposition of extraterritorial unilateral sanctions," was still declared in the document. Support to countries President Xi Jinping reaffirmed the view of a new world order that challenges Western rule, appealing to the construction of a fairer and more multipolar international system. "The SCO must oppose the Cold War mindset, the confrontation between blocks and the behaviors of intimidation," Xi said in the main speech of the summit, in an indirect reference to the United States. The Chinese leader defended a reform in global governance with greater representation to the global south and called for the “equal and uniform” application of international law, without double standards or the hegemony of the few. Xi also announced a set of concrete measures to face the challenges to development, at a time when the US trade war raises fears of global economic stagnation. Among the initiatives are 100 “small and exemplary projects” of well-being support in SCO countries, more than two billion Yuan in non-reimburseable aid and ten billion yuan in loans to the SCO Interbank Consortium in the next three years. XI also revealed plans to accelerate the creation of a SCO development bank to reinforce security and economy cooperation between member states. "We must expand the basis of cooperation and fully use the resources of each country, assuming the responsibility for peace, stability, development and prosperity in the region," he said. Regarding China's role in the world geopolitical system, Xi Jinping highlighted a series of measures and initiatives in which he considers that the country was a pioneer. In Monday's speech at SCO, he stressed that “we were the first to launch the cooperation of the track and route initiative”, and a large number of signature projects were developed ”. In addition, “cooperation at the level of industrial investment has significantly advanced, providing conducting forces for development and prosperity throughout the region”. China says it now has data that trade with SCO member countries has surpassed "the objectives that had been set," and the communications and transport network was "widely improved", with a land of land of almost 14,000 kilometers among the Member States. On Monday, Xi Jinping also pointed out that China was the first country to “present the vision of global governance based on a wide consultation, a joint contribution and benefit sharing,” making an “effort to practice true multilateralism”. "We deepen cooperation with the United Nations and other international organizations, and play a constructive role in international and regional affairs. We are always alongside international equity and justice, we advocate inclusion and mutual learning between civilizations. We oppose the hegemonism and policy of power, so we become a pro-action for peace and world development," said Chinese President. Hand in hand Prior to the official photo shoot on Monday, Russian presidents Vladimir Putin, and India Narendra Modi were seen walking hand in hand in the direction of Xi Jinping, with whom they kept a brief conversation, accompanied by interpreters. According to Modi himself, the two leaders traveled together in the same car for their bilateral meeting. Created in 2001 as a European-Asian security alliance between China, Russia and four Central Asian countries, SCO has expanded areas such as economic and commercial cooperation. According to Beijing, the organization currently brings together 26 countries in Asia, Europe and Africa, between full members, observers and dialogue partners. Myanmar and Türkiye are among the countries intended to full adhesion. Despite the growing influence, the group is still affected by internal disputes - such as India and Pakistan, or between Tajiquistan and Kyrguistan - that compromise its global effectiveness. A.S.S. / Agencies

item.title: Elections | Campaign advances for the last days to the “Mpop” style
item.description:
The elections for the Legislative Assembly are scheduled for the 14th, so the election campaign is almost over. In a report by Lusa agency, there are details of the “MPOP” style of the election campaign, with a lot of music and requests for financial support to the mixture
Crowded audience, all dressed in the gowns on the list with which they compete for the elections on the 14th; Chinese drums next to the stage and above candidates and supporters, various microphones, music and choreography. This is the campaign for Macao legislatures, in a style that can be called "MPOP". The microphones change hands, reproducing the same slogans with different voices, in short and acute scales, which end almost all in a party instruction. At this point, the drums are listened to loudly and the audience reproduces the last note heard, while shaking the political 'merchandising' that is handed over to the start of the rally: plastic hands to clap, numbers on the list with led lights, malleable straws, fans, all with the same color. Campaign actions in Macao, restricted to the last two weeks before legislative elections for the local parliament, do not contain speeches in the events of the six lists that will elect 14 of the 33 deputies to the Legislative Assembly (AL). The remaining 12 candidates are chosen through the associations, through the indirect suffrage, and there are still seven deputies appointed by the Chief Executive, in this case Sam Hou Fai. Describing campaign events is like an exercise of musical shows, namely the genus "Kpop", among the lists led by younger candidates, or the genre "pop old-myle", as if it was figures like Elvis or Olivia Newton John Risen. The concentrations are made up of the members of the lists and the people mobilized by them, some and the other dresses with the same uniforms. But there are no politicians on stage and viewers listening to them. In these events, politicians seem to be assumed as artists, but there are no audiences, because they seem to be part of the choreography. Finally, there are very few people besides and each other, that is, people watching who are not directly linked to the lists. Abstention is the great ghost that hangs over the whole process, which takes place for the first time under the framework of the new Electoral Law of April 2024, which aims to "reinforce the implementation of the" Macao Macao governed by Patriotas "principle. Economic challenges Ilia Chou, 40, an employee of the financial sector, was with a child and a friend watching one of these rallies and seemed to be one of those few people present not involved in the campaign list. He agreed to talk to Lusa after he had spoken to another microphone. Ilia was attracted to the list that was there because those people have a "young and community aspect" and are concerned with "offering prospects for progress" to young people. "Given the current challenging economic climate, we face a critical question: our young people now have fewer options than before. This specific aspect is what attracts me most in this initiative," he said. But “other groups also talk about youth and employment, what are the differences? Why do you like this particular group?” We asked. "I don't know them [the other groups]. Well, I was attracted to the charming characters of this list," he replied. "I think these four characters quite charming," Ilia added, they talk about "love, the title is very charming, and the color is pink, it looks very welcoming." Political programs are, without exception, lists of requests to an “provider father”, incarnated by the executive, who has the responsibility of managing a comfortable and growing financial reserve, fueled by taxes paid by the six game dealers in Macao. The numbers show this comfort. In August, the Macao Financial Reserve, which was always growing throughout the first half, reached 647.3 billion patacas, and was applied in subcontracted investments, deposits, current accounts, and credit securities. Lists want to be applied to initiatives such as the creation of a development fund and the reversal of 10 percent profits for distribution by all citizens, want to increase pensions or more money in consumer coupons, subsidies and maternity licenses, want more social housing, want free health and higher education, or simply require greater annual money distribution. Masses for the masses There are also other demands, such as promoting the diversification of the economy, measures to support the transformation and modernization of small and medium enterprises or intelligent city development, but the most significant part of the six lists programs points directly to the distribution of money from the government in the most varied forms. The other recipients of the requests are the game dealers, to which the candidates go with warnings that they are determined to defend the priority of residents in access to the best paid jobs. Macao's unemployment rate is 2 percent and permanent residents at 2.6 percent. That is, technically, Macau has full employment. However, as Lusa told a candidate, the employment issue has nothing to do with statistics, it just holds on with "perception." And in fact the question of unemployment, especially those who have just graduated, is a pressing issue of political programs, as HM indicated. This is the case of the first list to compete for direct suffrage, the “Association of United Citizens of Macao”, which is led by Song Pek Kei, a deputy linked to the Fujian community, who took the first steps in politics alongside businessman Chan Meng Kam. The list led by the deputy asks, for example, the creation of a share for residents in all professional areas, “support for employment and local companies”, and the guarantee that “85 percent, or more, employees are local residents”. The Nova Esperança list, led by José Pereira Coutinho, and one of the few macanese participants in these elections, asks for “employment for all”, a slogan present in his electoral program where the “employment priority for Macao's permanent residents is promised at game dealers”. Who goes out to their List campaigns for indirect suffrage may seem more discreet, but that doesn't mean there is no news. After investing in Global Media, Portugal, and betting on the real estate area, in Porto, Kevin Ho, the nephew of the first chief executive, Edmund Ho, bet on local politics, when entering the list “Union of Macao Business Interests”, led by José Chui Sa Peng. Also he is familiar, in this case, from a previous head of the Executive of MSAR, Chui Sai On, already removed from the political scene. In the case of these lists, representative of the sectors of labor, culture, education or business interests, employment is a concern, but what the candidates are looking for is a government that can support companies and finally diversify the economy. Thus, in the “union of business interests of Macao”, it is advocated “support for digital and high technology transformation to modernize traditional industries and develop emerging sectors”. Candidates promise to play the role of intermediaries between those who have difficulty maintaining in this business fabric and the executive by “listening carefully to the difficulties and claims of the commercial and financial industries, especially small and medium enterprises”. The names of the seven appointed deputies are not yet known, as the Chief Executive's choice is usually made public only after the elections. A.S.S. / Portuguese

item.title: QingMao | More than 100 million crossings in four years
item.description: In four years, Qingmao's border was used for over 100 million Macao border crossings and the interior. The number was pointed out by the newspaper or Mun, since yesterday was celebrated the fourth anniversary of the opening of the pedestrian border, which can only be crossed by people with Chinese nationality. According to the same data, this border has been registering an annual growth of more than 80 percent. For the quantity of the number, the fact that the border began to function at a time when the Covid-19 pandemic was lived, with major displacement restrictions, including quarantine compliance when cases were registered in Macau or on the other side of the border. The border is open 24 hours a day and the crossing can be done through the automatic gates. However, according to the newspaper or Mun, Macao and Interior authorities are currently considering installing a single machine system, with the same equipment to be used to register the exit of one territory and at the same time entry into the other. Currently, this process is separated in two moments, with the need to use equipment to register the output and another to mark the entry.

item.title: Patio do Espinho | Defended building demolition
item.description:
Representative Leong Hong considers that it is necessary to preserve the “traditional historical constructions” of the territory. However, the executive refuses that the demolished building falls into this category, because it has not been classified
The government defended the demolition of a building in paragraph 10 of the Patio do Espinho, after the fall of part of the structure facade. The position was taken through the response to a written interpellation of Deputy Leong Hong Sai, linked to the residents of Macao. In questioning, the legislator addressed the case to defend the need to ensure that urban renewal in the city is put into practice, while legislation is produced to ensure that “traditional historical constructions, in favor of maintaining the city's history and cultural ties”. In the response, signed by the director of the Soil Services and Urban Construction Directorate (DSSCU), Lai Weng Leong, the executive defends the demolition, considering that the infrastructure was not protected, which removes conservation obligations. This option was taken after the Cultural Institute (IC) was heard. "Building number 10 located in Travessa Três do Pátio do Espinho, after its collapse, was classified as being imminent in ruin and, after consulted the opinion of the IC, DSSCU proceeded, for public security reasons, to its demolition on August 8, 2025, which is currently completed," he was explained. "The IC stated that the aforementioned building is not part of the classified real estate, and these types of constructions must be regulated by the respective legal regulation in force on normal urban constructions," he was added. More than 600 Lai Weng Leong also quotes the data provided by the IC to indicate that the “current 165 macao -classified real estate items” are related to “more than 600 buildings”. At the same time, the IC also denies having responsibilities in the degrading state of the demolished building, as it is not part of the supervised heritage, as it is not protected. "Over the years, the IC is always based on the Cultural Heritage Settlement Law, having proceeded, each semester of the year, the verification and supervision of the security of ancient cultural relics in Macao, seeking to learn about their general preservation status and successfully stimulate and stimulate the owners to perform the necessary maintenance work," was justified. Regarding maintenance work by the owners, it is explained that the IC has a support service for private ones when they do works in their protected heritage have guidelines for “maintenance of outer appearance”, through the issuance of “technical opinions”, but also other supports “to perform restoration and maintenance works”.

item.title: Sanctions | Japanese deputy forbidden to enter Macau
item.description: The Central Government Ministry has decreed that Japanese deputy Seki Hei is prevented from entering Macao due to the application of a sanction related to comments on issues such as the islands disputed between China and Japan, Taiwan, Xinjiang, Tibet, Hong Kong and historical events. The decision was revealed yesterday through the MNE portal, and the input prohibition also applies to the interior of China and Hong Kong. Seki Hei was born in China, but naturalized Japanese. MNE also criticized Seki for “openly” visiting the Yasukini Temple in Tokyo, which pays tribute to the Japanese soldiers lying in the wars in which Japan participated, including soldiers who participated in the invasion of China and World War II. Seki's heritage in Chinese territories will be frozen, and Chinese companies and citizens are prohibited from establishing contact with the politician.

item.title: Air Macau retreats and applies lighter restrictions in the luggage
item.description: Air Macao turned back and decided to relieve some of the new restrictions on passenger baggage included in ticket purchases that had been released on Saturday. The retreat was published on Sunday through a statement on the company portal, and the most expensive tickets include greater capacity. Initially Air China -controlled carrier applied new limits, with economic tickets to include a single bag with a limit of 23 kilograms. If they were outdated, passengers would have to pay extra amount. In the Joyful class, the company's second cheapest, the maximum capacity was increased to 23 kilograms per bag, with passengers carrying up to two bags. Finally, in the business class, customers were limited to two bags, but each with a maximum weight of 32 kilograms. In addition, the initial rules also mentioned that the size per bag would be limited to 158 centimeters (total length, height and width and included from wheels and handle). With better However, on Sunday night, the company retreated by improving the cheaper ticket conditions, but penalizing the intermediate class of tickets, given the original changes. From September 17, the economic class is limited to a single bag with 32 kilograms instead of the original 25 pounds. For Joyful Class customers, a limit of 50 kilograms in the total of the two bags emerges. However, one bag can reach a weight of 32 pounds, saying that the other does not go beyond 18 pounds. In the business class the weight of each of the two bags will be 32 kilograms, in a total of 64 kilograms, with no changes. The restrictions of the dimensions were totally abandoned. The scenario does not fail to contrast with what currently happens. Until September 17 there are no limits in the number of bags. For example, economic clients have a 25 -pound limit, which means they can take more than one suitcase as long as it does not exceed this weight. Customers of the most advanced economic class, Joyful, have a 30 -pound limit while business class customers have a 40 -pound limit. These more expensive classes benefit.

item.title: Great Consumption Award | Trade revenues increase 10%
item.description:
Although traders highlight the increase in revenues and the number of customers, the program continues to deserve criticism from consumers, as discounts cannot be used during weekdays
On the first weekend to use the discount valleys issued within the latest round of the major consumption award, traders said revenues grew around 10 percent. The numbers were pointed out by several traders in statements cited by the newspaper or Mun. To the Chinese language newspaper, the owner of an unidentified bakery acknowledged that usually on the weekend sales volume is negatively affected by residents' travels to the interior of China. However, due to the discount program that can be used for purchases, the owner stated that the weekend revenues showed 10 percent growth, compared to periods without discounts. The owner also indicated that, to take advantage of discounts, the store tries to have its own more attractive promotions, and also with the launch of new products, which is expected to arouse greater interest from customers. In turn, the first -need product store manager indicated that the latest discounts contributed to the number of people to visit the space to increase by about 20 percent. However, he explained that people opt for the most necessary goods, without major expenses, such as toilet paper or personal and cleaning products for the home. Also in this case, success is not only attributed to the discounts of the initiative promoted by the government, the store also offers more attractive prices. More flexibility Despite the satisfaction of merchants, consumer levels arise as requests for greater flexibility, thinking of people with less economic capacity. In the Macao Macao Forum program of Macao's Chinese channel of some listeners to ask for more flexibility on time and in the use of discount coupons. A nickname Chan listener pointed out that the fact that coupons can only be used on the weekend is negative, because it always creates lines in the most popular stores. Chan considered that the experience of using discounts is bad, and that it should be possible to use discounts during the days of the week. Chan argued not to understand the resistance to make minor adjustments, according to the opinions of consumers, as several rounds of the program have already been performed. Another nickname listener Leong suggested the use of coupons on Friday. However, Leong warned the authorities to the possibility of the program leading to increased inflation in local commerce, so he requested an increase in prices by the authorities. In turn, a listener of nickname Law indicated that the program promoted by the government fails to think of people with less financial capacity. Law has exemplified that for students and the elderly it is difficult to use 200 -Patacas discount coupons because this value can only be used when at least 600 patacas spend.

item.title: Burla | “Dating” online cost 700 thousand patacas
item.description: A man lost 700,000 patacas, after making several payments hoping to receive sexual services from a woman she met online. The case was reported by the Judicial Police (PJ) and quoted yesterday by the newspaper or Mun. The resident is a “middle -aged” man who met the alleged woman in June this year, through an application of meetings. After a few weeks of conversation, the woman made herself available to go out with the man and provide her “sexual services” in exchange for money. The man agreed with the proposal and made a bank transfer to the woman. However, he always stated that he had never received the money. The man was repeating the transfers between June 17-30 until reaching 700,000 patacas. At that time, the resident suspected that he had been circumvented and complained. The PJ is investigating the case, but has not made any detention. The case was registered around noon on Praia do Manduco Street, when after screaming the woman was seen out of the building with wounds on her back. The authorities were called to the scene, and the woman was transported to the hospital. Also the man had to be transported to the hospital. The two have mild injuries, although at the time of the closing of this edition there were no details on the injuries of both. The exchange of aggression will have involved the use of white weapons so the case is being investigated by the authorities. Crime | Burlated man in 300 thousand patacas A “middle -aged” local man was circumvented in 300,000 patacas, after being convinced by burns who was being investigated in the countryside. According to information from the Judicial Police (PJ), the burns binded the man to pass the interior authorities. During the call they accused him of having practiced slogans inside and told him that he was being investigated. To proceed with the investigation, they asked the man to provide his bank details, which allowed his accounts to access. item.title: Glory Elevator | Sam Hou Fai Solidarity with victims
item.description: The chief executive, Sam Hou Fai, sent a letter to the President of the Republic, Marcelo Rebelo de Sousa, to express grief and solidarity with victims of the elevator of the Glory. "I want, (..), at this time, address the deepest feelings to the victims and their families and express our solidarity to all those involved in this tragedy," wrote the chief executive, referring to the accident in which 16 people died and 23 were injured. Sam also sent the “most felt condolences to Portugal and the city of Lisbon for the tragic accident (…) that caused the irreparable loss of human lives”. The leader spoke of a "moment of pain, dismay and mourning", but has shown confidence in how "the Portuguese people will be able to face this particularly hard moment and overcome this dramatic situation." Wednesday's accident caused 16 dead and injury to 23 people, nine of whom are still hospitalized in hospitals in Lisbon, five of which are in intensive care and one in the emergency observation service. The Judicial Police confirmed the nationalities of the 16 deadly victims: five Portuguese, two South Koreans, one Swiss, three British, two Canadians, one Ukrainian, one American and a Frenchman. On Thursday night, the Directorate of Tourism Services (STD) of Macau stressed any request for information or assistance, related to the accident, by residents of the territory.

item.title: Fine unconsciousness (i)
item.description: Last August 15, the emergency management office of the new Dapeng district, Shenzhen, in mainland China, instructed Nan'ao's office to implement a fine based on the “regulations on the establishment of the first natural disasters prevention decree in Shenzhen Dapeng, China”. It was a measure taken for the first time in the mainland China under these regulations. The media reported that the 19th of July, two tourists visiting Shenzhen, in mainland China, ignored the Typhoon warning and entered a dangerous area during a blue alert issued by the meteorology office at the time of Wipha's passage. At that moment, they asked the police for help. They had entered the rail at 10.30 h and called the authorities at 20.00, when the Typhoon Yellow Alert had already been raised. After receiving the request for help, the rescue and fire fighting brigade from the new Dapeng district and the Fire Fighting Brigade in the Nan'ao Forest led the rescue operations at night, having been able to locate the two men at 2.30 pm the next day. However, the typhoon continued to approach, forcing the teams to remain on the mountain. Finally they returned to the rail around 7.40 h, when the typhoon sign had already increased to orange, approximately 12 hours after the warning was issued. The two men claimed to be outdoor hiking enthusiasts. They only had lanterns and groceries and had no power bank. When they called the police, the mobile phones had only 5 percent battery. Subsequently, Nan'ao's office fined them under the “Regulation for the Prevention and Control of Natural Disasters in Shenzhen Special Economic Zone,” forcing each to pay 5,000 RMB. This was the first time in China that someone was fined under a regulation to prevent natural disasters. The regulation, which entered into force on November 1, 2023, indicates the areas with the potential for the occurrence of natural disasters, which may endanger lives or goods under certain circumstances and imposes restrictions on entries. Transgressors are subject to fines between 5,000 and 20,000 RMB and should cover the costs of rescue operations. In Macau there are similar situations. This year, during the passage of Typhoon Wipha, two tourists were strolling at the Governador Carvalho Bridge. After a resident warned, the judicial police arrived quickly and withdrew the two men. Subsequently, they were fined under the traffic regulation because they ignored the “sign of prohibition to cross the bridge”. In Hong Kong, there is the law of natural parks. Although explicitly prohibits the entrances during the Tapfan passage, the Department of Agriculture, Fisheries and Conservation, for safety reasons, will issue the “walking safety guidelines” and will close some recreational areas. These measures aim to prohibit residents from entering the natural parks during the passage of typhoons, and penalizing transgressors with fines and eventually with a penalty up to 14 days in prison. These legislations share a guiding thread: the penalty of those who enter delimited and signaled areas with the warning “no entry is not allowed.” However, there is no legislation to regulate the practice of dangerous activities during natural disasters, such as pursuit of typhoons and surfing. We will continue our analysis next week, which will focus on the regulation of these risk activities. item.title: Cape Verde - Si Ka Ten Txuba, Morê Di Sedi, Si Txuba Ben, Morrê Fogade
item.description: It is no longer news, but it remains very alive in the memory of the Cape Verdeans the tragedy that plagued the islands of St. Vincent and Santo Antão, a few weeks ago. And everything that happened is related not only to our old acquaintance of the Azores, but also to the topography of Africa in the latitude of the Cape Verdean islands and the simultaneity of certain meteorological and oceanographic circumstances. In order to begin the formation of a tropical depression, which may or may not evolve in the sense of its intensification, giving rise to tropical storm and, later, the hurricane1, it is necessary that the ocean surface temperature is relatively high (statistically equal to or greater than 27ºC), that there is a small disturbance in the field of atmospheric pressure (a voucher designated by “wave of the east”) Vertical of this disturbance varies little with altitude (shear, or Wind Shear, weak). The simultaneity of these circumstances occurred in the early hours of August 11, 2025, which caused the death of nine people and transformed many homes and infrastructure into wreckage, on the island of São Vicente. In addition to the natural factors mentioned, they also contributed to this calamity the weak memory that characterizes human beings, regarding meteorological phenomena, and the fact that the National Institute of Meteorology and Geophysics (INMG - Cape Verde Meteorological Authority) has no strategically placed meteorological radars to proceed to a more efficient surveillance of systems evolution meteorological. If the authorities remembered that such situations have already occurred, although sporadically, they would probably not allow the construction of houses on the beds and banks of the almost permanently dry streams. But nature does not forgive and, whenever it rains intensely, the water drips to the lower areas, resuming paths already traveled, that is, the beds of these streams. During the dawn of this day, after many of the inhabitants of Mindelo became fun at the characteristic parties of August, a tropical depression caused heavy rain, especially in the islands of São Vicente and Santo Antão. The amount of hasty water reached 192.3 mm in just 5 hours, higher than the average annual precipitation, which corresponds to about 38 5 liters of water to fall on the surface of 1 m² during this period, practically throughout the island of São Vicente. It rains little in Cape Verde, but when it rains, it sometimes happens with great intensity, usually by the action of weather disturbances designated by east waves or tropical depressions that derive from them, and can evolve into tropical storms and hurricanes. Some of these meteorological systems that occur in the North Atlantic begins in the vicinity of Cape Verde, a country consisting of an archipelago located in the North Atlantic Ocean, approximately between the 15th and 17th N and the Meridians 22nd and 26th West, formed by two subgroups: Satellian Islands (Santo Antão, St. Vincent, Santa Luzia, Saint North and Boavista) of parallel 16 N and islands of empowerment (May, Santiago, Fogo and Brava), south of the same parallel. The archipelago suffers almost permanently, especially the islands of Well, Northeast winds, the so -called high winds, relatively dry due to the part of the route to occur over the Sahel. These winds, which blow in the southeast edge of the Azores anticyclone, sometimes carry sand and dust of the Sáara that arrive in Cape Verde and beyond, crossing a large length of the Atlantic. In turn, the southeast winds that, due to the rotation of the Earth inflate to the southwest after crossing the Ecuador (Coriolis effect), associated with the almost permanent anticyclone of Santa Helena, located in the South Atlantic, more humid converges with the northeast executions, giving rise to an area designated by Intertropical Convergence Zone (Intertropical Convergence Zone - Zone - Zone - Zone - Zone - Zone - Zone - Itcz). In this area, due to the convergence of the two types of heights, the air is required to rise giving rise to the condensation of water vapor and the formation of clouds often vertical development, designated by cumulonimbus, characterized by strong precipitation and thunderstorms. This zone of convergence moves throughout the year, following the apparent movement of the sun, with some delay, reaching the northern latitude in August/September, regressing south as the year advances, reaching the lower latitude in December/January. The weather conditions in Cape Verde are mainly determined by ITCZ's position in relation to the archipelago. Thus, the rainy season (August, September and October) occurs when ITCZ ​​is north, and the dry season covers the months from April to June, being July the month of transition. You can also consider the months from November to March as an intermediate station. During the rainy season, sometimes east waves are formed in the southern regions of ITCZ, due in part to the action of the mountains in Africa, which introduce disorders into the air flow, progressing from east to west between latitudes 5º and 20º N, covering the region where Cape Verde is located. One of these waves of east was formed on August 9 and evolved into tropical depression. When the sustained maximum winds reached 34 knots (63 km/h) depression went to the category of tropical storm with the name Erin2 on August 11, having evolved to hurricane on the 15th. Later, on August 16, reached category 5, the strongest of the Saffir-Simpson3 hurricane scale. When it caused the greatest damage in Cape Verde, the weather system was not yet attributed, which only happened when tropical depression evolved into tropical storm. Its route followed approximately the designated path, in the meteorological media, by “Cape Verde route”, which consists of a route around the Azores anticyclone, near Cape Verde, progressing west, northwest, northern, recurring to the northeast, and may reach Europe as an extratropical depression. The well-known singer Bana (pseudonym of Adriano Gonçalves), the “king of warm”, in the song “Sina de Cape Verde”, expressed well the hardness of the climate of his country: “Si Ka Ten Txuba, Morê Di Sedi, Si Txuba Ben, Morrê Fogade” (if there is no rain dies thirst, if the rain comes drowned). Also Manuel Lopes4, long before Bana, portrayed in his soap opera “The Flagellates of the East Wind”, the tragedy, although, opposite, the Cape Verdean people for long periods of drought. Olavo Rasquinho (Meteorologist) References Tropical cyclones, before reaching the hurricane classification, passes through several phases, depending on wind velocity: tropical depression, tropical storm and hurricane (typhoon in northwestern Pacific and China Sea). When the maximum sustained winds are equal to or greater than 34 nodes (63 km/h) tropical depression passes the tropical storm (Tropical Storm). When equal to or greater than 64 knots (119 km/h), it takes the name of hurricane, typhoon, or cyclone, according to the regions. In the case of Northwest Pacific and Southern Sea of ​​China, there is still an intermediate category, between the tropical storm and the typhoon, which is the severe tropical storm, when the maximum sustained winds reach equal or higher values ​​48 nodes (88 km/h) and less than 64 knots. The depression system only begins to be designated by an international name when reaching the tropical storm category. In the case of Northwest of the Pacific and Southern Sea of ​​China, the names are attributed by Escap/WMO Typhoon Committee, whose secretariat has been based in Macao since 2007. In the Atlantic, the names are attributed by the Hurricane Committee, whose secretariat is based in Miami. On the Saffir-Simpson Hurricane Scale, these meteorological systems are classified based on the speed of the maximum winds sustained within 1 minute: Category 1 - 64 to 82 nodes (119–153 km/h) Category 2 - 83 to 95 knots (154–177 km/h) Category 3 - 96 to 113 knots (178–208 km/h) Category 4 - 114 to 135 knots (209–251 km/h) Category 5 -> 135 knots (> 250 km/h) Manuel dos Santos Lopes (1907-2005)-writer, poet and essayist, born in Cape Verde. Together with Baltazar Lopes da Silva, Jorge Barbosa and other Cape Verdean intellectuals, he founded in Mindelo in 1936, the magazine “Clarity”, integrated into a movement of social, cultural and political emancipation of the Cape Verdean people.

item.description: Another edition of the Fringe Festival began last Friday, which usually brings Macao several performance arts in a narrow contact with the public, the stage and the street. Within digital and interactive experiences, the “Adventure Book‘ a hidden window in Macau ’-version with musical accompaniment”, a Kaze Chan project, Chikara Fujiwara, Minori Sumiyoshiyama and Erik Kuong. item.title: “Macao Art” | New exhibitions to see from the end of the month
item.description:
For several months that “Macao Art - Macau International Art Biennial 2025” wanders through the territory, but is far from coming to an end. From the 24th of this month, three more projects will be inaugurated: “Hands borrowed”, “goods and warriors” and “non -terminal”. The first is at the D. Pedro V Theater, the rest lead to reflections and interactions between Rua da Tercena and Macau Centro Square
In September there is still time and space to enjoy the new exhibitions that “Art Macau - International Art Biennial of Macau 2025” brings to the territory. From the 24th onwards, three projects integrated in the “Exhibition of Public Art”, subordinate to the theme “Waves and Paths”, are presented to the public. These are five pieces or sets of works by nine artists, entitled “Hands borrowed”, “goods and warriors” and “non-terminal”. In addition, also on September 24, between 19h and 8:30 pm, the “Conversation and Dialogue: The Public Nature of Public Art” colloquium in the Auditorium of the Macao Art Museum, which features Wu Wei, co-curator of the Biennial, and artists Ann Hamilton, Yin Xiuzhen, Jason Ho and Assemblis Gang. The lecture will focus on “on ways of cultivating a new, dynamic and vibrant approach in the context of 'face -to -face' public art”. Registration takes place until September 19th on the Macao Single Account platform. Ann Hamilton, an American artist, is the name behind one of the new projects on display, “Hands borrowed”, patent at the D. Pedro V Theater. This artist is, according to a note from the Cultural Institute (IC), “internationally recognized for its large-scale multimedia facilities, public projects and their performance collaborations”. In Macao the artist recreates “The Historical Memory of Sino-West Trade with Multimedia Art”. Interactive paths Another of the artists participating in the Colloquium, Yin Xiuzhen, is considered a “renowned Chinese contemporary artist”. It presents in Macao the “non -terminal”, an interactive video installation patent in the square of the Cultural Center of Macau (CCM). This installation, which can be seen until December 12, focuses on a “static luggage treadmill” made of metal, wood and rubber, forming an interactive platform, where the public can rest, move and socialize. Through the treadmill, there are plastic rugs where the audience can run, skateboard and bike. The nine screens hanging above the installation display live images of the place and scenes of pre-recorded life, and the audience can also send their own videos to create a lively theater of life together. “This work transforms cultural spaces and artistic scenes into an experimental field for social behavior, highlighting the idea that the journey of life and art has no end and suggesting the fluidity of life, memory and identity,” describes the IC. THE ROLE OF AGRICULTURE Finally, the British Interdisciplinary Assembly Collective, known for revitalizing urban spaces through community and creative design, presents “goods and warriors”, a project that “serves to reflect on the relationship between land and people”. Available at Number 19 of Tercena Street in Macao, this project “examines the current developments of small -scale agriculture in China and the UK, using video facilities and micronarrative techniques to directly present scenes of daily life and work in small farms in both regions”. Thus, it is exploited “the symbiotic relationship between earth and humanity through the display of documents and the holding of public events, thus creating an emotional connection between Earth and the public of Macao”, describes the IC. With “goods and warriors”, it presents a “upward perspective” of the connection of agriculture with people and the “unique value of the small-scale agricultural economy for ecological balance, community resilience and economic stability, challenging the preconceived idea of ​​'urban centrism' and also re-examining the construction role of rural practices in the construction of a sustainable future”. “Goods and Warriors” is also available for public visit until December 12 this year, aiming to “establish a link between land, food and human senses and develop a new dialogue between the urban audience and the agricultural landscapes that nourish it, at the same time offering a visual validation for the cultural value and the survival wisdom necessary for future urban development in the growing uncertain uncertainties of globalization”.

item.title: FINAM | Cuca Roseta acts next to the Chinese orchestra of Macau
item.description:
This year's Macao International Music Festival poster brings Portuguese fadista Cuca Roseta, who goes on stage next to the Macao Chinese Orchestra, in a fusion of sounds that is no longer new to Macao. Also highlight for the opera “Carmen”, by French Georges Bizet
The Macao International Music Festival (FINAM) has, for the third consecutive edition, with a fadista. This time, the elected is Cuca Roseta that will act accompanied by the Chinese orchestra of Macao (OCM), like Mariza in 2024, the organization announced on Friday. The Macao Cultural Center (CCM) hosts, on October 11, the 43 -year -old Lisbon, described in a statement as a “Portuguese fado diva” by the Cultural Institute (IC), which organizes the festival. The FINAM program underlines that the concert “materializes a cultural exchange”, between OCM's “rich cultural heritage” and the “jazz, bossa nova influences and songs of the world” in the style of Cuca Roseta. The end returned to the stage in 2022, after a two -year interregnum due to the pandemic, with a program that included two shows of foreign guests, one of which from Portuguese António Zambujo, but only through recorded performances. The return of foreign artists took place in 2023, after the end of restrictions on entry into the region, in a program that included a Gisela João concert. Last year, it was Mariza's turn with OCM. The orchestra was also created during the Portuguese administration of Macao in 1987 - the year also the first edition of Fimm - and uses traditional Chinese instruments. Since then he has performed concerts with Portuguese musicians, including fadists (and brothers) Camané and Hélder Moutinho, guitarist Custódio Castelo and the Valentine's ward group. Return of “Carmen” The end starts on October 3, with the classic opera of Frenchman Georges Bizet (1838-1875) “Carmen”, which will be taken to the scene by the opera of Zurich and the Opera Comic de Paris, under the baton of Norwegian conductor Eivind Gullberg Jensen. The show also includes collaboration with the Macao Orchestra, the China National Symphonic Orchestra and the Macao Youth Choir. The festival program also features two concerts with works by Xian Xinghai (1905-1945), a composer born in Macau and known for writing patriotic songs during the fight against the Japanese invasion, from 1937. The two concerts, on October 18 and November 7, will celebrate not only the 120th anniversary of Xian Xinghai's birth, but also the 80th birthday of the end of World War II in the Pacific. On October 31, it will be the turn of “fingertips”, which will gather a Russian couple, Bailaria Svetlana Zakharova and violinist Vadim Repin, accompanied by several main dancers of the Bolshoi Ballet, headquartered in Moscow. Mahler and Rachmaninoff Also highlighting the show “Thomas Hampson sings Mahler”, scheduled for October 16, at 8 pm, in the one that promises to be “a night of huge artistic mastery for the voice of Thomas Hampson, a world -recognized baritone, in a recital dedicated to Gustav Mahler's evocative songs”. According to the festival's programming, Hampson has long “been greeted as one of the greatest vocal interpreters of the Austro-Bohemian composer”, now participating in the end with a repertoire “of unparalleled emotional vision, vocal elegance and intellectual depth”. “In this recital, Hampson explores a selection of the most appreciated songs, unique jewels in the composer's work, most of them related to the legendary 'des knaben wunderhorn' (the magic horn of the boy). Hampson's interpretation illuminates thorough and complex poetry that defines the art of the great master. It promises to be a highlight of this festival, a celebration of the eternal power of songs, ”is described on the event poster. With the support of Melco also takes place another concert of classical music, but this time dedicated to a Russian composer, Rachmaninoff. The show “Mikhail Pletnev and the Rachmaninoff International Orchestra” take the stage of the Grand Auditorium of the CCM on October 25 and 26, from 20h. On November 8th it is the turn of the same stage to receive the performance “The Four Seasons - Daniel Hope and the GSTAAD Festival Orchestra”, from 20h. The program consists of the compositions of Vivaldi and Max Richter, namely with the "four stations", originally composed of the first, and then "restoration - the four stations of Vivaldi", a tribute from the second. It describes the End poster that "when Antonio Vivaldi's prime baroque merges with Max Richter's postmodern reinvention, a timeless celebration of beauty and innovation is born," Richter's version consists of a "bold transformation of Vivaldi's original." item.title: Music | Noyb presents “Improvised Live Sessions” in the mud
item.description: It is already tomorrow, September 6, that the event “None of Your Business (Noyb) Improvised Live Sessions”, which brings to Macau a series of artists and DJs in which the music played of improvisation and experimental way promises to be the watchword. The party takes place between 17h and 11pm and brings to the Van Nam factory, on Olympic Avenue, on the mud, “a avant -garde world of makeshift musical action, video installations and an innovative modular synthesizer workshop,” says Noyb on social networks. Thus, “visionary artists from Macao, Portugal, Spain, Japan and other places are joined in the mud, creating a unique tapestry of sounds and visual art”, and there will be no shortage of gastronomy spaces and the “company of other art enthusiasts” to make music and enjoy it. The poster is made with Logoss, which acts the day before in Beishan, Zhuhai; DJ Sniff, Larsq, Ezara Thustra and DJs Tongrim and Fon. Experimental maneuvers Regarding the artistic path of the participants at this Experimentation Party, Fon was born in Canton, Guangzhou, but was created in Macao. However, he also lived in New York and Los Angels, where he worked as a musician and conceptual artist. “Its diverse formation inspires the exploitation of sound, visual arts, performance and improvisation,” says Noyb. Fon's musical taste is also "strongly influenced by New York Vanguardists, such as H0L0 and Bossa Nova Civic Club, as well as the" Underground "scene of parties in Macao and the song Trap Cantonense." Also noteworthy is the sound project “Larsq”, by Rui Rasquinho, designer and illustrator of Lisbon that has long made Macau to his home. With "Larsq" the public can enjoy "pedals of effects, noise synthesizers and a guitar under the influence of improvisation, situated somewhere between the abstract and narrative." In the case of DJ Sniff, it is a musician, curator and educator whose work “is done with different practices that combine 'djing, instrument design and free improvisation”. DJ Sniff has worked in Amsterdam and was a visiting assistant professor at the University of Hong Kong University between 2012 and 2017. He has collaborated with names like Evan Parker, Otomo Yoshihide, Paul Hubweber, Tarek Atoui, Senyawa and Ken Ueno. From Spain, more concretely Tenerife, the Lagoss project comes, and its presentation is immediately warned: listening to these sounds can "cause involuntary wandarings by islands that do not exist." Logoss is therefore an "audiovisual project whose sound goes beyond the spectrum of what our ears are used to," inspired by "exotic mythologies and spiritual sounds." Thus, “immersive sound landscapes that challenge any simple categorization” are created, with a song that is “a singular fusion of synthesizer cosmic explorations, unstable dub rhythms and imagined island field recordings, all sustained by a healthy dose of psycho-psycho, improvisation and 'live looping' of electronic and acoustic instruments”. In this way, the audience can see, listen and feel tomorrow "a particular sound and organic universe, which the band itself describes as the island folklore of the future or cyber-tropicalism."
